intro: Mitracarpus scaberulus, commonly known as the rough mitracarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its rough, hairy texture gives it its common name, and it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Mitracarpus scaberulus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
